author: junkyjerk
title: simple but good
review: i ordered this set via internet and i got this today. it´s a good addition to any construction site. it fits percectly into mine at least. but it misses something and because of this i cannot rate it 5 of 5. a shovel is missing. shall the worker handle the concrete with his hands?

author: mrmitch
title: Construction crew gets added man & machine
review: LEGO doesn't put out enough of these liitle sets in my opinion. Simple to build, unique addition to the construction crew in my City. The drum does rotate when you turn the handle at the front of the wheel barrel. If you have any collection at all I'm sure you may have another shovel he can use - agree it should have been included with the set. Price is right, works well with the other crew mempbers in my city - a good buy - great little set. You will be happy to have him in your collection, I recommend this one highly.

author: asianlego
title: Another Great Impulse Sets for 2008
review: 2008 is a great year to stock up on impulse sets. This one is a very good addition, as I doubt that many of you have a cement mixer in your collection. Even better if City is your main priority. At that price, you just can't pass it up before the prices rise again.

author: _obelix_
title: First set i am giving less then 5!
review:
This is a good little set. Good but not great. As with other impulses this set has i minifig, a cart with a cement mixer, some left-over cement for playing and that's it. This set would have been great if only it had two small parts: a shovel, and something to hold it. It would have been great and would fit right beside the mixer. Without it it's still a good set for building up your city.

This brings up the final, a 4 out of 5.

author: lotographia
title: A small set with a nifty gimmick.
review:
The gimmick of this set is that if you push it forward, the wheels also spin the barrel. This is the smallest set I've seen with a movement-based gimmick like that, and it's implemented with a neat, simple design.

As a previous reviewer noted, this set really should come with a shovel. That's why I'm not giving it a five, which I would have for the gimmick alone.

author: galonschiente
title: MINIFIG FACE
review:
I really enjoy lego sets especially this one bcause of the minifigure's face

  Pros:

 This set is fantastic i got it at asda. This set could have had an extra set of wheels but its still perfecto!
g00D 6ye

author: legomaniac
title: Great little mixer
review:
I got it last week on sale, must say I love to have many construction workers as possable, and the mixer is perfect for fixing lego potholes in the road.

     As others say i like how the drum rolls on the wheels making it turn, he could of had a shovel though, but I have plenty of spare ones.  

Also I never had the cone shaped part before, use that piece for a jet engine

author: kaboomlegoman
title: bad.
review: I'm serious, this set has some serious issues. First of all, the cement pieces are really annoying and get lost easily. The spinning thing doesn't go far. And you have to spin the steering wheel really hard to get them out. Really, I am dissapointed. The minifigure is basic and pathetic. Overall, really bad set and don't get it.:(

author: Boidoh
title: Small, Boring and Ugh!
review:
This set is quite small and boring on its own. I understand that its an impulse set but really, why cant it be likes it brother "5611 Public Works" with 31 pieces and many stuff, that set was like a 5 usd set. Ok back to the review, this set would go GREAT with the Front End Loader and the Dozer and I know, i have them. Now to the pros and cons:

Pros

  • A minifigure (well thats what impulse sets are about. collecting minifigure at a small price)
  • Little cement mixer
  • A wheel i havent seen in ages

Cons

  • Well where i live its for 9 Belize Dollars which is 4.50 US Dollars, so its not such a good deal.
  • Lacks Pieces
  • The cement mixer doesnt turn very well
  • Not good on its own

Its a nice set for any construction fan or city fan. But not on its own. The people in the US would have it at a better price, maybe about $6.50 in Belize currency so i cant talk the price for the people up there.

author: CMoore
title: good set
review:
This set is real nice but there are some pros and cons.

pros
- it has a nice minifig
- it does not take to long to build

cons
- the drum does not tilt all the way

But the rest of it is real great. You may think that the builder is not very good but it is; you will see.

author: United_Bricks
title: Excellent
review:
This set is excellent it is good for young builders and old. I would give this set a five out of five because it is good if you are building a construction site.
I got this set when it first came out. It is good if you just got some pocket money. I liked the minifigure because he has good detail.
I especially like how if you turn the wheel piece the drum of the mixer will turn side to side.
You get grey studs what you put in the mixer.
This set is very good value for your money.

author: legofan3810
title: Builder
review:
This set is pretty OK. The figure is particularly regular, but that's fine with me. I got this set as a free gift from my first brick master. Now on to the Pros and Cons.

Pros
Nice figure
Cement Mixer really turns
Cool wheel thingy. 

Cons
Cement peices get lost easy

Overall, a 4 out of 5.

author: av8r1973
title: Cheap way to round out a construction scene
review:
This is a simple little impulse set.  A standard (nothing wrong with that) orange-suited construction minifig does the work of carting this little mixer around to patch sidewalks or curbs.

The construction was simple enough and is sturdy.  The wheels are far enough that it's a stable little unit and it looks pretty realistic.  There's even some "concrete" in the form of a few little studs.

Two drawbacks for the kit that could have made it worth the price.  First, who works with concrete without a shovel.  Of all kits, this one should have had a shovel.  Second, when the minifig lets go of the cart, there isn't anything to keep that end of the cart up.  No kickstand or tire.  A simple little 1-stud-wide tire brace would have been perfect here.

As others have mentioned, the kit doesn't do much by itself.  If you have a little construction area in your city, it does well.  Also, if you want to set up a little road patching scene, it does well there, too.  It's not just another vehicle.  With the drawbacks mixed in with the good stuff, this is a solid 4.

author: BrickTVReviews
title: A High Quality Impulse Set
review:
Welcome back to BrickTVReviews and we have a 2008 City impulse set with 23 pieces and 1 minifigure which costs $3.

 

Parts

                              This is a great source of rare but not new parts such as the grey thick cone piece and separate sttering wheel.

 

Minifigure

                              It is a construction worker with a normal hard hat, my complain is that this torso is getting common for Construction sets.

 

Model

                             The model is a mini cement mixer, the mixer can turn because of the wheel at the end.

 

Instruction

                             The instruction is a slip in type.

 

Conclusion 

                             This is a great set to fit in any collection and the price is approariate.

author: LEGOSLUG
title: Fix holes in the road for LEGO City!.....with your hands?!!?!
review:
Here's my review of the LEGO City set 5610 builder.

The Minifigure:

An average LEGO City builder figure, nothing special.
It has an orange torso and legs, and a builder's helmet.

The Build:

An easy build, a 4 year old would have no trouble.
The finished model is nothing special, but a good set to add to your LEGO City Collection.
 

Pros

* 1 Minifigure
* you get a cement mixer.

Cons

* The minifigure mends the road with his hands?!
* No Shovel for the Minifigure.

All in all it is a good set, not the best ever released, but worth getting if you like LEGO City.

4/5 for this set.

 

LEGOSLUG

 

P.S. Pleae see and rate my other Reviews and Bricklists.

author: i_luv_lego
title: nice
review:
I got this set in January this year i found it to be very good, here is my review on it.

Lets start with the minifig, so the minifig in this set is just a generic builder with a red hat orange uniform wearing dark blue grey gloves, his face show that he is very hard working and happy towards his job.

The build. I think the build is very simple for what features the set has

So the main part of the set is quite realistic as when you move the cement mixer the drum spins around this is quite realistic to the real thing, also you notice that there is a wheel that you can turn to let the cement fall out, the cement is is 3 dark blue grey round pieces.

Praise

-the cement mixer is realistic

-the minifig is nice

-nice play features

Cons

-should have a shovel for the builder to pick up the cement

Overall 9/10

I hope this review was helpful :)
